function.name: core_memory_append
function.description: Append to the contents of core memory.

inner_monologue.description: Your reasoning to use this function.

name.description: Section of the memory to be edited (persona or human).

content.description: Content to write to the memory. All unicode (including emojis) are supported.

function.name: core_memory_replace
function.description: Replace to the contents of core memory. To delete memories, use an empty string for new_content.

inner_monologue.description: Your reasoning to use this function.

name.description: Section of the memory to be edited (persona or human).

old_content.description: String to replace. Must be an exact match.

new_content.description: Content to write to the memory. All unicode (including emojis) are supported.

function.name: recall_memory_search
function.description: Search prior conversation history using a string.

inner_monologue.description: Your reasoning to use this function.

page.description: Allows you to page through results. Only use on a follow-up query. Defaults to 0 (first page).

function.name: archival_memory_search
function.description: Search archival memory using semantic (embedding-based) search.

inner_monologue.description: Your reasoning to use this function.

page.description: Allows you to page through results. Only use on a follow-up query. Defaults to 0 (first page).

function.name: send_message
function.description: Sends a message to the human user

inner_monologue.description: Your reasoning to use this function.

message.description: Message contents. All unicode (including emojis) are supported.

function.name: recall_memory_search_date
function.description: Search prior conversation history using a date range.

inner_monologue.description: Your reasoning to use this function.

start_date.description: The start of the date range to search, in the format datetime, e.g. 2023-11-06T20:43:32.223Z.

end_date.description: The end of the date range to search, in the format datetime, e.g. 2023-11-06T20:43:32.223Z.

page.description: Allows you to page through results. Only use on a follow-up query. Defaults to 0 (first page).

function.name: archival_memory_insert
function.description: Add to archival memory. Make sure to phrase the memory contents such that it can be easily queried later.

inner_monologue.description: Your reasoning to use this function.

content.description: Content to write to the memory. All unicode (including emojis) are supported.
